content:
3.33 
Disputes between spouses concerning the performance of obligations and the exercise of rights 
1. If the spouses cannot agree on the performance of their obligations or the exercise of their rights, either spouse has the right to apply to the court to have the court settle their dispute. 
2. The court must take measures to reconcile the spouses when resolving their dispute. 
3. The court must decide on the matrimonial dispute taking into account the interests of the spouses' minor children and the interests of the family as a whole.
